chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Likely to Cause Great Bodily Harm
Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Likely to Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Keith Wing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligently Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Likely to Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)3.
  • Negligently Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Likely to Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.285(2)(a)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Corey Lemke or go upon any premises where he has cause to believe he may be present.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy.
Defendant shall not terminate any counseling or mental health treatment without approval of his provider.
Defendant shall report any new medications and medical appointments to the Agent within 72 hours.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed - may be utilized by his Agent upon application to the Court.

Consecutive to: to 14CF345.

Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay RHT $4,650.00 and pay 10% rest. surcharge.
3.  def. to provide DNA sample
4.  def. to participate in any assessments/counseling as directed by his Agent and follow any treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to have no contact (directly or indirectly) with Corey Lemke or go upon any premises where he has cause to believe he may be present.
6.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
7.  def. to possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
8.  def. to obtain all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
9.  def. to not terminate any counseling or mental health treatment w/o approval of his provider.
10.  def. to report any new medications and medical appointments to the Agent w/in 72 hours.
11.  14 CF 345 - Ct. #1 - and 15 CF 39 - Ct. #1 - 4 months co jail - consecutive - stayed and may be utilized by his Agent upon application to the court.
